course_title: Variable Topics in Human Health: Health Innovation Delivery
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 22 / Seats Avail: 6Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes:
(Same as SOC 489 4)
This course guides students through the process of planning the implementation and evaluation of a health innovation. Human-centered and collaborative innovation models guide development of a sustainable and ethical business plan. (This course is the required capstone for all seniors with a Health Innovation Concentration graduating in Spring 2024, Summer 2024, or Fall 2024)
This class will take place at The Hatchery. The Hatchery is located at 1578 Avenue Pl #200, Atlanta, GA 30329. You can get here: 
By foot: We're less than a 10-minute walk from Kaldi's Coffee on Eagle Row. 
By Car: There is a parking deck just opposite our front door on Avenue Place, and we can provide free parking validation for up to 3 hours. 
By e-bike: Helbiz has established a dockless bike share program servicing Emory campus, and there is a drop-off location at Emory Point. 
By Bus: The A, B, and Executive Park buses all pass near The Hatchery on Clifton Road. For more shuttle info go to https://transportation.emory.edu/shuttles
course_description: Seminar or lecture in various topics on human health. May be repeated for credit (up to 9 hours) when topic varies.
sections: Class Nbr: 2605, Section #: 2, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: TTh 10-11:15a, Instructor: Hall-Clifford/Grubb, Status: Open
